ratings.comment: He is a amazing professor. Gives amazing feedback and gives easy extra credit.
2-3 papers per week, and you have to google a lot information in order to write the paper. All the mandatory readings are irrelevant to the assignment.

The grading is very subjective. You can hit all the rubric points in a paper and still be marked down if they wanted to hear more with very stricked word limits. It's really a research and writing course. It's only 3 credits and it requires 2-3 papers per week; very time consuming. The professor my or my not respond to your questions.
Unclear grading criteria and rubrics, the TA's gave very general feedback.

Horrible professor. Gives plain wrong answers to student questions. Podcasts are long for no reason as they contain very little of value. TA grade assignments and give absolutely useless feedback. They won't point out specific mistakes, they'll just give vague comments. Regret taking this class.
If you want to write a bunch of essays for a business course, this is for you

Miguel did not seem to care a whole lot about this class. He put in minimal effort as he used other people's materials, relied on his TA's (who were inconsistent), and his exams used questions from other sources. The expectations in this course were not clear. I had high hopes for this course but was disappointed. Not an overly difficult course.

Very unclear and vague directions, generic rubric for most assignment, some major assignments were worth more points than minor assignments (?). Took numerous days to respond to emails/discussion posts. Would not take this class nor professor again.
